results.title: Stories of survival with Les Hiddins. [Part 2]
results.creator_credit: David Telfer, Richard Walker, Jack King, Tim Clark and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Bush tucker man series”.
Les Hiddins travels Australia-wide tracking down stories of survival in the wilderness. “Gold Fever” looks at the legend of Lasseter’s lost reef of gold in Central Australia. “The Passionate Prussian” retraces Leichardt’s exploration from Moreton Bay to Point Essington and the mystery which shrouds his disappearance. “The Great Misadventure” looks at the ill-fated Burke and Wills expedition and how a knowledge of Bush Tucker may have changed the outcome. The final episode “Into the Vilest Country” features the Cape York Penninsula as Les travels to the area in a manner which contrasts that of the cumbersome Kennedy exploration.

results.title: Stories of survival with Les Hiddins. [Part 1]
results.creator_credit: David Telfer, Richard Walker, Tim Clark and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Bush tucker man series”.
Les Hiddins relates survival stories in four episodes. ‘The “Coffee Royal” affair’ set in Western Australia traces the story of Charles Kingsford Smith whose reputation was damaged by one of Australia’s earliest aviation disasters. ‘The Cannibal convict’ tells of one of the earliest convict escapees, Alexander Pierce in the wilds of south-west Tasmania. The footsteps of determined explorer John McDouall Stuart is retraced in ‘The Best of them all.’ ‘The Dutch settlement’ follows clues across Australia to investigate a report made last century about a Dutch colony established in Central Australia following a shipwreck.

results.title: Stories in the Air
results.creator_credit: Gerben Cath and Video Books Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
A video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by professional storytellers and have been selected for children aged five to eight years old.

results.title: Stories in stone
results.creator_credit: Dennis Porter, Ian Austin and East Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hidden India Series”.
Mark Twain described India as, “the one land that all men desire to see and having seen once, even a glimpse, would not give that glimpse for all the shows of the rest of the globe combined”. This video explores many of the familiar and not so familiar monuments of hidden India. They range from massive carvings to mind-boggling man made temples.

results.title: Stories from the Turkish community : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Ifran Hassan, Mustafa Yucel, Umit Ugur, Bayram Ocal, Yusuf Hazar, Figen Hasimoglu, Memet Gunes, Riza Guclu, Huseyin Duman, Fatma Coskun, Kenan Besiroglu and ACMI
results.brief_description: Eleven Turkish migrants, from Cyprus and Turkey, tell of their experiences migrating and making Australia their new home. They tell of the reasons for moving here, the journey to Australia and share their feelings for their family, their community and their adopted country.

results.title: Stories from the Jewish Community
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Adriana Gomberg, Idit Benjamin, Alain Herz, Adam Barolsky, Adam Nudelman, Emma Levy, Sheiny New, Jenni Klempfner, Ximena Silberman, Astrid Silberman and ACMI
results.brief_description:
An ACMI digital storytelling workshop creating stories through and about the Australian, Jewish community in partnership with The Jewish Museum of Australia.
These ten personal stories tell of the reasons for emigrating to Australia, whether it be for love or for a better life. These stories are woven with the excitement of new beginnings, the heartache of separation and the challenges of fitting respected traditions in with the new culture.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Adriana Gomberg, Idit Benjamin, Alain Herz, Adam Barolsky, Adam Nudelman, Emma Levy, Sheiny New, Jenni Klempfner, Ximena Silberman, Astrid Silberman and ACMI

results.title: Stories from the earth
results.creator_credit: Katie Jennings and KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Fire on the rim”.
In days long gone, the lack of factual explanation for the eruptions, quakes and ancilliary disasters throughout the “ring of fire”, gave rise to myths and legends as means of coping with the impact of the erratic disturbances. Cultures both old and new have been partly shaped by such events, producing beliefs affecting the social behaviour of people living with the unpredictability of the earth. This program examines some of the fascinating stories that have emerged in these communitites.

results.title: Stories from Gippsland : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Lyn Skillern, Bridget Nicholson, Zephlyn Neilsen, Shirlee McPherson, Lyn Johnson, Graham Goulding, Vivianne Everett, Ruth Burleigh, Rowena Ashley and ACMI
results.brief_description: Nine members of the Gippsland community tell of the things dearest to them : whether they be close friends, life changing experiences, treasured animals or inspirational family members. These things and people have all served the participants in providing them with a sense of home.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Lyn Skillern, Bridget Nicholson, Zephlyn Neilsen, Shirlee McPherson, Lyn Johnson, Graham Goulding, Vivianne Everett, Ruth Burleigh, Rowena Ashley and ACMI
results.description: Nine members of the Gippsland community tell of the things dearest to them : whether they be close friends, life changing experiences, treasured animals or inspirational family members. These things and people have all served the participants in providing them with a sense of home.
description_for_label: Nine members of the Gippsland community tell of the things dearest to them : whether they be close friends, life changing experiences, treasured animals or inspirational family members. These things and people have all served the participants in providing them with a sense of home.
